resources.string: First step of using the application is calibration. In this step, some referenced samples need to be recorded for making the calibration curve, which helps neutralize the environment inside the kit. After finishing this stage, the kit is ready for analyzing the target sample. This step must be performed before analyzing the target sample. For more information, please click these buttons below.
For recording the sample, please click the below button.
For reviewing previous captures, please click the below button
Press the "Analyze" button for measuring the sample.
This is one point calibration, which requires a 0ppb sample.
This is two point calibration, which requires 0ppb and 50ppb samples.
This is three point calibration, which requires 0ppb, 50ppb and 500ppb samples.
This function allows users override manually calibration values. Highly recommended for quick adjust and test; in real using, those above methods of calibration are more accurate.
NO CALIBRATION HAS BEEN PERFORMED. (THE DEFAULT WILL BE USED FOR MEASURING)
Moving the cursor to ideal area. Defaults values will be applied for the calibration curve if no calibration has been performed.
After clicking "Done", the position of cursor will be fixed for others measurements.

The PPB value for the sample as following. Do you want to save the result?
%1$s
Step 1: Adjust the cursor to ideal area.
Step 2: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 0ppb sample.
Step 1: Adjust the cursor to ideal area.
Step 2: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 50ppb sample.
Step 3: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 500ppb sample.
Step 1: Adjust the cursor to ideal area.
Step 2: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 0ppb sample.
Step 3: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 50ppb sample.
Step 4: Click "Analyze" for analyzing the 500ppb sample.

By changing the calibration values, you can apply by yourself each value in textboxes below. The gray numbers in textboxes are defaults. Click apply when finish editing (the default values will be set in each blank text field). Clear button is simply removing all current editing.
Sorry, you can\'t use this app without granting permission.
